intro: Arrabidaea rhodothyrsus, commonly known as the red torch tree, is a flowering plant native to the eastern and southern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive red, tubular flowers. The plant produces long, woody pods that contain several seeds, and its leaves are compound with small, oval leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens despite its invasive tendencies in certain regions.
